title: Ticket #2861: Add global event log-related tests
description:
Note: I split this out from #2858 because the new tests need to go into 7.7, whereas the actual fix for the problem should go into 7.6.

I think there should be at least two aspects of fixing the tests:

  1. The global event log should be turned on for all tests (or at least all DAGMan tests). I guess at least one test should check that events actually show up in the global event log (!).
  2. There should be at least one DAGMan test where the global event log is unwriteable, and we make sure that DAGMan still runs okay.
remarks:
2012-Mar-06 09:44:41 by wenger:
To turn on the global event log for the normal nightly tests, you need to modify src/condor_scripts/batch_test.pl. Something like this: 

          print FIX "MAX_MASTER_LOG          = $logsize\n";
          print FIX "MASTER_DEBUG            = D_COMMAND\n";


  +       print FIX "EVENT_LOG               = \$(LOG)/EventLog\n";
  +       print FIX "EVENT_LOG_MAX_SIZE      = $logsize\n";
  +
          if($iswindows == 1) {
                  print FIX "WINDOWS_SOFTKILL_LOG = \$(LOG)\\SoftKillLog\n";
          }

2012-Mar-10 10:38:29 by nwp:
job_dagman_global_event_log-A tests that events are actually written to the event log.

job_dagman_global_event_log-B tests that events are written to the user log when the event log is not writable.

The test worked in this test. I checked the output for the necessary semantics.
